item.title: "Last month, rental assistance hit another barrier. By mid...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Last month, rental assistance hit another barrier. By mid October, the Northeast Denver Housing Center, one of two nonprofits that administer Temporary Rental and Utility Assistance for Denver, spent its entire budget for the program known as TRUA. Kamabela, who lost his job as a hotel maintenance engineer after the pandemic hit, was affected himself. He had applied for help with October rent."

Denverite

High demand for rental assistance in Denver is one measure of the pandemic’s economic impactBy mid-October, one of two nonprofits that administer rental assistance for the city had spent its entire budget for the program.High demand for rental assistance in Denver is one measure of the pandemic’s economic impactBy mid-October, one of two nonprofits that administer rental assistance for the city had spent its entire budget for the program.See more at DENVERITE.COM
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "Most Coloradans may have to wait well into 2021 to get a...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"Most Coloradans may have to wait well into 2021 to get a vaccine against the coronavirus, the state’s epidemiologist said Tuesday.

Drug manufacturer Pfizer on Monday announced its vaccine could be available starting around the end of the year, and that preliminary studies show it could be up to 90 percent effective in preventing the virus."

Colorado Public Radio

News about successful COVID-19 vaccine trials is encouraging, but state epidemiologist Rachel Herlihy says it'll be several months into 2021 before doses are widely available.

cpr.org

With Colorado’s Third Wave Raging On And A Vaccine Still Far Off, State Leaders Call For Mask-Wearing And Social Distancing

News about successful COVID-19 vaccine trials is encouraging, but state epidemiologist Rachel Herlihy says it'll be several months into 2021 before doses are widely available.News about successful COVID-19 vaccine trials is encouraging, but state epidemiologist Rachel Herlihy says it'll be several months into 2021 before doses are widely available.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "On Saturday, a new statewide protocol will be officially...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"On Saturday, a new statewide protocol will be officially enacted making Colorado one of the first states to allow pharmacists to prescribe PrEP and PEP, preventative HIV medications.

PReP, or pre-exposure prophylaxis, is more than 90 percent effective in preventing an HIV infection, and PEP, post-exposure prophylaxis, can reduce the risk of getting HIV after exposure by more than 80 percent — and yet the drugs are underused. "

Colorado Public Radio

Public health experts hope that easier access will lead to more people taking PrEP and PEP, preventative HIV medications.

cpr.org

Colorado Patients Can Now Get Preventative HIV Medications From Pharmacists

Public health experts hope that easier access will lead to more people taking PrEP and PEP, preventative HIV medications.Public health experts hope that easier access will lead to more people taking PrEP and PEP, preventative HIV medications.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “It is important that youth themselves are part of the...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“It is important that youth themselves are part of the strategies and how services are delivered,” said Rep. Leslie Herod, who spearheaded the Caring for Denver ballot initiative and now serves as its board chair. “This is an opportunity for young people, who often feel invisible, to take the lead in shaping their futures.”

Caring for Denver considers anyone up to age 26 as a youth, and the total amount available for all grant awards in this funding area is up to $10 million."

Colorado Politics

The goal of the grants will be to reduce youth harm, increase young people’s “resilience” to life pressures, improve mental health and address substance misuse issues.

coloradopolitics.com

Caring for Denver opens $10M grant opportunity to fund mental health, trauma and addiction support for youth

The goal of the grants will be to reduce youth harm, increase young people’s “resilience” to life pressures, improve mental health and address substance misuse issues.The goal of the grants will be to reduce youth harm, increase young people’s “resilience” to life pressures, improve mental health and address substance misuse issues.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Rep. Herod told 303 Magazine that hundreds of Black, Brown...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Rep. Herod told 303 Magazine that hundreds of Black, Brown and Indigenous men and women first shared their experiences with hair discrimination in education, the workforce and housing while at an initial community hearing this past February.

When the time came, they were ready to testify and advocate for themselves during the official legislative hearing a month later in March, Rep. Herod explained.

“I think, quite frankly, a lot of Coloradans who don’t have to deal with ...these issues directly were appalled to learn that this was happening in Colorado — and was happening so often. For me just having the conversation really did change the debate and does work at changing people’s hearts.”

303 Magazine

See MoreTo live authentically is to step into your own unique power. However, when you’re bombarded with societal messages to conform and adhere to Eurocentric ideals, celebrating your innate worth c…

303magazine.com

Locals Weigh in on the Impact of the Historic CROWN Act

To live authentically is to step into your own unique power. However, when you’re bombarded with societal messages to conform and adhere to Eurocentric ideals, celebrating your innate worth c…To live authentically is to step into your own unique power. However, when you’re bombarded with societal messages to conform and adhere to Eurocentric ideals, celebrating your innate worth c…
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Herod, whose first meeting as a JBC-member-elect will be...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Herod, whose first meeting as a JBC-member-elect will be Wednesday, said “being the first Black woman to serve in the role in decades only heightens how proud I am to be selected.”

“It’s time to build back a stronger, more just and equitable economy in our state, and to ensure no one is left behind in our state’s recover, she said.”

The Gazette

Speaker of the House-elect Alec Garnett of Denver Tuesday named Rep. Leslie Herod of Denver and Rep. Julie McCluskie of Dillon as the House Democrats' members on the Joint Budget

gazette.com

Speaker-elect Alec Garnett appoints Rep. Leslie Herod to Joint Budget Committee

Speaker of the House-elect Alec Garnett of Denver Tuesday named Rep. Leslie Herod of Denver and Rep. item.title: “About 27.9% of residents surveyed said they are struggling to...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“About 27.9% of residents surveyed said they are struggling to meet household expenses, 20.2% expect someone in their household to face a loss of income in the next month, and 8.5% describe not having enough food to eat the past week, according to the weekly Household Pulse Survey.”

The Denver Post

As the state braces for a third wave of COVID-19 cases and the tighter restrictions that some with that, a weekly survey from the U.S. Census Bureau finds that many Colorado households are still st…

denverpost.com

Many Colorado households still struggling as latest virus wave gains momentum

As the state braces for a third wave of COVID-19 cases and the tighter restrictions that some with that, a weekly survey from the U.S. Census Bureau finds that many Colorado households are still st…As the state braces for a third wave of COVID-19 cases and the tighter restrictions that some with that, a weekly survey from the U.S. Census Bureau finds that many Colorado households are still st…
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “The three buildings will rise up to three stories and help...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The three buildings will rise up to three stories and help families bridge the gap between being homeless and being housed, said Rachael Fowler, a Salvation Army spokesperson. Families will be able to stay at up to 85 apartments for three months while receiving job training at the new community center that will also house a food pantry, after-school programs, a gym, and a chapel. The charity will help tenants find jobs and permanent homes and will help pay for a deposit on a place to live.

“We do full-on case management with these families,” Fowler said.”

Denverite

West Denver is about to get the western U.S. headquarters of the nonprofit, too.

denverite.com

A Salvation Army campus to help unhoused families get on their feet is slated for Barnum’s Alameda Avenue

West Denver is about to get the western U.S. headquarters of the nonprofit, too.West Denver is about to get the western U.S. headquarters of the nonprofit, too.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Gov. Jared Polis extended the state’s face covering mandate...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Gov. Jared Polis extended the state’s face covering mandate for 30 days and ordered state employees to work remotely for the next few weeks as he once again implored Coloradans to take the coronavirus more seriously.”

Colorado Public Radio

More than 1,000 people remain hospitalized in Colorado with confirmed cases of COVID-19.

cpr.org

Polis Extends Statewide Mask Mandate And Cheers Hopeful Coronavirus Vaccine News

More than 1,000 people remain hospitalized in Colorado with confirmed cases of COVID-19.More than 1,000 people remain hospitalized in Colorado with confirmed cases of COVID-19.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "In an effort to avoid another stay-at-home order, city...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"In an effort to avoid another stay-at-home order, city officials on Friday announced a “Home by 10” order that will attempt to limit gatherings and late-night drinking by closing non-essential businesses at 10 p.m. nightly.

These new Denver restrictions come as COVID-19 hospitalizations across Colorado surpass the previous, April peak, and one in every 100 Denverites is now contagious with the disease, according to the state."

The Denver Post

For the next 30 days starting Sunday, Denver residents should plan to buy alcohol and wrap up dinner reservations on any given night by 10 p.m.

denverpost.com

What Denver’s new curfew means for dining out, buying alcohol

For the next 30 days starting Sunday, Denver residents should plan to buy alcohol and wrap up dinner reservations on any given night by 10 p.m.For the next 30 days starting Sunday, Denver residents should plan to buy alcohol and wrap up dinner reservations on any given night by 10 p.m.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: "The incoming Democrats ran on platforms pledging to uphold...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

"The incoming Democrats ran on platforms pledging to uphold transparency, tackle college affordability and commit to diversity and inclusion efforts. Whether hindering partisan divides prevail on the board remains to be seen, but current, incoming and former Democratic regents all agree that three fresh members and a new majority are sure to shake up a board ripe for rehabilitation."

The Denver Post

Whether hindering partisan divides prevail on the board remains to be seen, but current, incoming and former Democratic regents all agree that three fresh members and a new majority are sure to sha…

denverpost.com

Democrats will control CU’s Board of Regents for the first time in 41 years. What do they hope to accomplish?

Whether hindering partisan divides prevail on the board remains to be seen, but current, incoming and former Democratic regents all agree that three fresh members and a new majority are sure to sha…Whether hindering partisan divides prevail on the board remains to be seen, but current, incoming and former Democratic regents all agree that three fresh members and a new majority are sure to sha…
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “I’ve got to say, seeing the first female VP of this country...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“I’ve got to say, seeing the first female VP of this country be a woman of color, it speaks volumes. Not only to me as a woman of color, but to the soul of this nation and where we want to go,” said Herod.

“This time where young women of color, young girls of color, us as women can see ourselves in that position. And say, there are no ceilings we cannot break, we can do it and we will do it together because that’s who we are.”

CBS4 Local

As Vice President Elect Kamala Harris is representing a new face of political power, a Colorado lawmaker who’s also broken barriers is proudly speaking out.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Rep. Leslie Herod Weighs In On Kamala Harris Making History

As Vice President Elect Kamala Harris is representing a new face of political power, a Colorado lawmaker who’s also broken barriers is proudly speaking out.As Vice President Elect Kamala Harris is representing a new face of political power, a Colorado lawmaker who’s also broken barriers is proudly speaking out.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “On Monday, Denver City Council will vote on the second TRUA...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“On Monday, Denver City Council will vote on the second TRUA infusion this year. Council will be considering an expedited request from the city housing department to provide almost $2 million in additional funds to the Northeast Denver Housing Center for the rental assistance program. The housing department also requested $550,000 in additional funds for Brothers Redevelopment Inc., the other TRUA administrator.”

Denverite

By mid-October, one of two nonprofits that administer rental assistance for the city had spent its entire budget for the program.

denverite.com

High demand for rental assistance in Denver is one measure of the pandemic’s economic impact

By mid-October, one of two nonprofits that administer rental assistance for the city had spent its entire budget for the program.By mid-October, one of two nonprofits that administer rental assistance for the city had spent its entire budget for the program.

item.title: “As of Wednesday afternoon, 3,303,265 ballots have been...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“As of Wednesday afternoon, 3,303,265 ballots have been returned out of an active voter roll of 3,780,115 — a turnout rate of 87 percent.”

Colorado Public Radio

As of Wednesday morning, 3,222,676 ballots have been returned out of an active voter roll of 3,780,115 — a turnout rate of 85 percent.

cpr.org

Coloradans Turned Out In Record Numbers To Vote In 2020. Here’s What That Means

As of Wednesday morning, 3,222,676 ballots have been returned out of an active voter roll of 3,780,115 — a turnout rate of 85 percent.As of Wednesday morning, 3,222,676 ballots have been returned out of an active voter roll of 3,780,115 — a turnout rate of 85 percent.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “The restrictions will last at least 30 days, Mayor Michael...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“The restrictions will last at least 30 days, Mayor Michael Hancock announced Friday. Some businesses, including grocery stores, pharmacies, hospitals and the airport, are exempt from the public health order. Under the order, restaurants can continue curbside pickups and deliveries after 10 p.m.; no businesses can serve alcohol after 10 p.m. and public and private gatherings of any number of people not from the same household are prohibited between 10 p.m. and 5 a.m.”

Colorado Public Radio

The restrictions will last at least 30 days, Mayor Michael Hancock announced

denverite.com

Denver asks all residents to be home by 10 p.m. to curb the spread of COVID-19

The restrictions will last at least 30 days, Mayor Michael Hancock announcedThe restrictions will last at least 30 days, Mayor Michael Hancock announced
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “Denver officials celebrated Saturday with the revelation that...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“Denver officials celebrated Saturday with the revelation that Democrats Joe Biden and Kamala Harris had apparently won the presidential election. “

Colorado Politics

Denver officials celebrated Saturday with the revelation that Democrats Joe Biden and Kamala Harris had apparently won the presidential election.

coloradopolitics.com

Denver leaders celebrate apparent Biden-Harris victory

Denver officials celebrated Saturday with the revelation that Democrats Joe Biden and Kamala Harris had apparently won the presidential election.Denver officials celebrated Saturday with the revelation that Democrats Joe Biden and Kamala Harris had apparently won the presidential election.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Love hearing from @spiritofgracemusic on this historic day!
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Love hearing from @spiritofgracemusic on this historic day!
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: “She says the Black Lives Matter movement galvanized voters of...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

“She says the Black Lives Matter movement galvanized voters of color but, she says, the addition of Kamala Harris to the ticket was a turning point.

“What it meant was that we have a president who is willing to walk the talk, who is willing to not only say Black lives matter, but then prove it by putting a Black woman at the top of the ticket with him. He didn’t have do that, especially with the numbers we had back then, you know, we were going be trouncing Trump, but that’s not how it came out.”

CBS Local

African Americans one of the voting blocks that turned out in record numbers. They broke overwhelmingly for Joe Biden and will be a deciding factor in the states still counting.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

Black Lives Matter Protests Drive Turnout Among African American, Young Voters

African Americans one of the voting blocks that turned out in record numbers. They broke overwhelmingly for Joe Biden and will be a deciding factor in the states still counting.African Americans one of the voting blocks that turned out in record numbers. They broke overwhelmingly for Joe Biden and will be a deciding factor in the states still counting.
item.author: Leslie Herod

item.title: Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have...
item.content:encoded:
Representative Leslie Herod

Incredibly humbled by this feature in 5280 and honored to have community support for this work. We all have a story to tell. Our stories are our strength and our voices will be heard.

"Forget political stereotypes: This history-making legislator is unapologetically progressive, is insistent that state government can be bipartisan (even now), and wants to transform the criminal justice system. And that's just the start of her ambitions.”

- 5280 Magazine
